revised_title: India's Contribution to Geodesy: Geodetic Investigations and the Figure of the Earth
tldr: This article discusses the geodetic operations conducted in India to determine the lengths and amplitudes of meridional and longitudinal arcs for a mathematical calculation of the Earth's figure. It highlights the influence of geodetic investigation on the Great Trigonometrical Survey of India and the discrepancies met with at baseline and triangle junctions. The article also explores the deflections of the plumb line due to local attractions and the need to eliminate these errors in determining the Earth's figure.
